A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Some exciting and well-shot action sequences. Excellent pacing\, and deft coordination of multiple story lines. Comic relief was certainly funny\, but was relief from...what exactly? The story felt morally and emotionally shallow. Character deaths didn't have much weight. The failings of the Jedi were insufficiently explored; only teased at. And no one exhibited much growth or evolution. Nor did we seem to learn anything: nothing about the Jedi religion\, nothing about Rey\, nothing about Snoke\, and really nothing about Kylo's rebellion (save for fragments of conflicting perspectives). After two years of build up and hype\, the creators casually discarded the viewers' two most hotly debated questions.  No spoilers here\, but the treatment of these two issues not only ruins this film for me\, but makes me enjoy The Force Awakens less. Could not be more disappointed.
